trans-unit.source: Windows Phone 8.1 policy settings | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone 8.1 policy settings | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Intune supplies a range of built-in general settings that you can configure on Windows Phone 8.1 devices.
trans-unit.target: Intune supplies a range of built-in general settings that you can configure on Windows Phone 8.1 devices.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, you can specify OMA-URI values to create custom settings that are not available from Intune.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, you can specify OMA-URI values to create custom settings that are not available from Intune.

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone 8.1 policy settings in Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone 8.1 policy settings in Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Intune supplies a range of built-in general settings that you can configure on Windows Phone 8.1 devices.
trans-unit.target: Intune supplies a range of built-in general settings that you can configure on Windows Phone 8.1 devices.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, you can specify Open Mobile Alliance Uniform Resource Identifier (OMA-URI) values to create custom settings that are not available from Intune.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, you can specify Open Mobile Alliance Uniform Resource Identifier (OMA-URI) values to create custom settings that are not available from Intune.

trans-unit.source: Use the Microsoft Intune **Windows Phone general configuration policy (Windows Phone 8.1 and later)** to configure the following settings for Windows Phone 8.1 devices:
trans-unit.target: Use the Microsoft Intune **Windows Phone general configuration policy (Windows Phone 8.1 and later)** to configure the following settings for Windows Phone 8.1 devices:

trans-unit.source: **Mobile device security settings** – Choose from a list of predefined settings that let you control a range of features and functionality on the device.
trans-unit.target: **Mobile device security settings** – Choose from a list of predefined settings that let you control a range of features and functionality on the device.

trans-unit.source: **Compliant and noncompliant apps** - Specify a list of apps that are compliant or not compliant in your company.
trans-unit.target: **Compliant and noncompliant apps** - Specify a list of apps that are compliant or not compliant in your company.

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone devices can block or allow installation of these apps.
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone devices can block or allow installation of these apps.

trans-unit.source: Enables settings in this policy to be applied to Windows 10 Mobile devices in addition to Windows Phone 8.1 devices.
trans-unit.target: Enables settings in this policy to be applied to Windows 10 Mobile devices in addition to Windows Phone 8.1 devices.

trans-unit.source: **Require a password to unlock mobile devices**
trans-unit.target: **Require a password to unlock mobile devices**

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether users must enter a password to access their devices.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether users must enter a password to access their devices.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the type of password that will be required, such as alphanumeric or numeric only.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the type of password that will be required, such as alphanumeric or numeric only.

trans-unit.source: **Required password type – Minimum number of character sets**
trans-unit.target: **Required password type – Minimum number of character sets**

trans-unit.source: Specifies how many different character sets must be included in the password.
trans-unit.target: Specifies how many different character sets must be included in the password.

trans-unit.source: There are four character sets: lowercase letters, uppercase letters, numbers, and symbols.
trans-unit.target: There are four character sets: lowercase letters, uppercase letters, numbers, and symbols.

trans-unit.source: However, for iOS devices, this specifies the number of symbols that must be included in the password.
trans-unit.target: However, for iOS devices, this specifies the number of symbols that must be included in the password.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the minimum number of characters that are required in the password.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the minimum number of characters that are required in the password.

trans-unit.source: Specifies that simple passwords such as ‘0000’ and ‘1234’ can be used.
trans-unit.target: Specifies that simple passwords such as ‘0000’ and ‘1234’ can be used.

trans-unit.source: **Number of repeated sign-in failures to allow before the device is wiped**
trans-unit.target: **Number of repeated sign-in failures to allow before the device is wiped**

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of times an incorrect password can be entered before the device is wiped.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the number of times an incorrect password can be entered before the device is wiped.

trans-unit.source: **Minutes of inactivity before the screen turns off**
trans-unit.target: **Minutes of inactivity before the screen turns off**

trans-unit.source: Specifies the amount of time a device must remain idle before the screen is automatically locked.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the amount of time a device must remain idle before the screen is automatically locked.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of days before the device password must be changed.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the number of days before the device password must be changed.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether previously used passwords are remembered to prevent the user from using them again.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether previously used passwords are remembered to prevent the user from using them again.

trans-unit.source: **Remember password history** – **Prevent reuse of previous passwords**
trans-unit.target: **Remember password history** – **Prevent reuse of previous passwords**

trans-unit.source: Specifies how many previously used passwords are remembered.
trans-unit.target: Specifies how many previously used passwords are remembered.

trans-unit.source: Requires that the data on supported mobile devices be encrypted.
trans-unit.target: Requires that the data on supported mobile devices be encrypted.

trans-unit.source: For Windows Phone 8 devices, you must set this to **Yes**.
trans-unit.target: For Windows Phone 8 devices, you must set this to **Yes**.

trans-unit.source: Lets the user capture the contents of the screen as an image file.
trans-unit.target: Lets the user capture the contents of the screen as an image file.

trans-unit.source: Enables the device to submit diagnostic information to Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: Enables the device to submit diagnostic information to Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: Enables a Microsoft account to be linked to the device.
trans-unit.target: Enables a Microsoft account to be linked to the device.

trans-unit.source: Enables the device to connect to non-Microsoft email accounts.
trans-unit.target: Enables the device to connect to non-Microsoft email accounts.

trans-unit.source: Enables or blocks the built-in web browser on devices.
trans-unit.target: Enables or blocks the built-in web browser on devices.

trans-unit.source: Lets users connect to the app store from the device.
trans-unit.target: Lets users connect to the app store from the device.

trans-unit.source: Enables or blocks the device's camera.
trans-unit.target: Enables or blocks the device's camera.

trans-unit.source: Lets the device use removable storage such as SD cards.
trans-unit.target: Lets the device use removable storage such as SD cards.

trans-unit.source: Enables or disables the Wi-Fi functionality of the device.
trans-unit.target: Enables or disables the Wi-Fi functionality of the device.

trans-unit.source: Enables the use of Wi-Fi tethering on the device.
trans-unit.target: Enables the use of Wi-Fi tethering on the device.

trans-unit.source: **Allow automatic connection to free Wi-Fi hotspots**
trans-unit.target: **Allow automatic connection to free Wi-Fi hotspots**

trans-unit.source: Enables the device to automatically connect to free Wi-Fi hotspots and automatically accept any terms of use.
trans-unit.target: Enables the device to automatically connect to free Wi-Fi hotspots and automatically accept any terms of use.

trans-unit.source: Sends information about Wi-Fi connections to help the user discover nearby connections.
trans-unit.target: Sends information about Wi-Fi connections to help the user discover nearby connections.

trans-unit.source: Enables the device to utilize location information.
trans-unit.target: Enables the device to utilize location information.

trans-unit.source: Enables operations that use near field communication.
trans-unit.target: Enables operations that use near field communication.

trans-unit.source: Enables or disables the Bluetooth functionality of the device.
trans-unit.target: Enables or disables the Bluetooth functionality of the device.

trans-unit.source: Enables copy and paste functionality on devices.
trans-unit.target: Enables copy and paste functionality on devices.

trans-unit.source: Settings for allowed and blocked apps
trans-unit.target: Settings for allowed and blocked apps

trans-unit.source: In the **Allowed and blocked apps** list, specify a list of apps that you want to allow or block by using the following information:
trans-unit.target: In the **Allowed and blocked apps** list, specify a list of apps that you want to allow or block by using the following information:

trans-unit.source: A single policy can only contain a list of allowed or blocked apps.
trans-unit.target: A single policy can only contain a list of allowed or blocked apps.

trans-unit.source: You cannot specify both in the same policy.
trans-unit.target: You cannot specify both in the same policy.

trans-unit.source: **Block devices from opening the listed apps**
trans-unit.target: **Block devices from opening the listed apps**

trans-unit.source: Lists the apps that are not managed by Intune, and which users are not allowed to install and run.
trans-unit.target: Lists the apps that are not managed by Intune, and which users are not allowed to install and run.

trans-unit.source: **Allow devices to install only the listed apps**
trans-unit.target: **Allow devices to install only the listed apps**

trans-unit.source: Lists the apps that users are allowed to install.
trans-unit.target: Lists the apps that users are allowed to install.

trans-unit.source: Users cannot install any other apps.
trans-unit.target: Users cannot install any other apps.

trans-unit.source: Apps that are managed by Intune are automatically allowed.
trans-unit.target: Apps that are managed by Intune are automatically allowed.

trans-unit.source: Adds an app to the selected list.
trans-unit.target: Adds an app to the selected list.

trans-unit.source: Specify a name of your choice, the URL to the app in the app store, and the app publisher (optional).
trans-unit.target: Specify a name of your choice, the URL to the app in the app store, and the app publisher (optional).

trans-unit.source: For more help, see How to specify URLs to app stores later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: For more help, see How to specify URLs to app stores later in this topic.

trans-unit.source: Imports a list of apps that you have specified in a comma-separated values file.
trans-unit.target: Imports a list of apps that you have specified in a comma-separated values file.

trans-unit.source: Use the format, application name, publisher, and app URL in the file.
trans-unit.target: Use the format, application name, publisher, and app URL in the file.

trans-unit.source: Lets you edit the name, publisher, and URL of the selected app.
trans-unit.target: Lets you edit the name, publisher, and URL of the selected app.

trans-unit.source: Deletes the selected app from the list.
trans-unit.target: Deletes the selected app from the list.

trans-unit.source: If you specify a list of allowed apps for Windows Phone 8.1 devices, you must add the Company Portal app to this list or it will be blocked.
trans-unit.target: If you specify a list of allowed apps for Windows Phone 8.1 devices, you must add the Company Portal app to this list or it will be blocked.

trans-unit.source: Reference information for allowed and blocked apps
trans-unit.target: Reference information for allowed and blocked apps

trans-unit.source: How to specify URLs to app stores
trans-unit.target: How to specify URLs to app stores

trans-unit.source: To specify an app URL in the allowed and blocked apps list, use the following format:
trans-unit.target: To specify an app URL in the allowed and blocked apps list, use the following format:

trans-unit.source: From the [Windows Phone Apps+Games](http://www.windowsphone.com/en-us/store/overview) page, search for the app that you want to use.
trans-unit.target: From the [Windows Phone Apps+Games](http://www.windowsphone.com/en-us/store/overview) page, search for the app that you want to use.

trans-unit.source: Open the app’s page, and copy the URL to the clipboard.
trans-unit.target: Open the app’s page, and copy the URL to the clipboard.

trans-unit.source: You can now use this as the URL in either the allowed or blocked apps list.
trans-unit.target: You can now use this as the URL in either the allowed or blocked apps list.

trans-unit.source: **Example:** Search the store for the Skype app.
trans-unit.target: **Example:** Search the store for the Skype app.

trans-unit.source: The URL you use will be **http://www.windowsphone.com/store/app/skype/c3f8e570-68b3-4d6a-bdbb-c0a3f4360a51**.
trans-unit.target: The URL you use will be **http://www.windowsphone.com/store/app/skype/c3f8e570-68b3-4d6a-bdbb-c0a3f4360a51**.

trans-unit.source: Use the Microsoft Intune **Windows Phone custom configuration policy** to deploy OMA-URI settings that can be used to control features on **Windows Phone 8.1 devices**.
trans-unit.target: Use the Microsoft Intune **Windows Phone custom configuration policy** to deploy OMA-URI settings that can be used to control features on **Windows Phone 8.1 devices**.

trans-unit.source: These are standard settings that many mobile device manufacturers use to control device features.
trans-unit.target: These are standard settings that many mobile device manufacturers use to control device features.

trans-unit.source: This capability enables you to deploy Windows Phone settings that are not configurable with an Intune general configuration policy.
trans-unit.target: This capability enables you to deploy Windows Phone settings that are not configurable with an Intune general configuration policy.

trans-unit.source: For information about the settings you can configure with these policies, see [Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies](manage-settings-and-features-on-your-devices-with-microsoft-intune-policies.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about the settings you can configure with these policies, see [Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies](manage-settings-and-features-on-your-devices-with-microsoft-intune-policies.md).

trans-unit.source: For help creating OMA-URI settings for Windows Phone devices, see [Windows Phone 8.1 MDM protocol documentation](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn499787.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For help creating OMA-URI settings for Windows Phone devices, see [Windows Phone 8.1 MDM protocol documentation](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn499787.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Enter a unique name for the policy to help you identify it in the Intune console.
trans-unit.target: Enter a unique name for the policy to help you identify it in the Intune console.

trans-unit.source: Provide a description that gives an overview of the policy and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.
trans-unit.target: Provide a description that gives an overview of the policy and other relevant information that helps you to locate it.

trans-unit.source: In the **OMA-URI Settings** section, click **Add** to add a setting.
trans-unit.target: In the **OMA-URI Settings** section, click **Add** to add a setting.

trans-unit.source: You can also edit or delete an existing setting.
trans-unit.target: You can also edit or delete an existing setting.

trans-unit.source: In the **Add or Edit OMA-URI Setting** dialog box, specify the following information:
trans-unit.target: In the **Add or Edit OMA-URI Setting** dialog box, specify the following information:

trans-unit.source: Enter a unique name for the OMA-URI setting to help you identify it in the list of settings.
trans-unit.target: Enter a unique name for the OMA-URI setting to help you identify it in the list of settings.

trans-unit.source: Provide a description that gives an overview of the setting and other relevant information to help you locate it.
trans-unit.target: Provide a description that gives an overview of the setting and other relevant information to help you locate it.

trans-unit.source: Select the data type in which you will specify this OMA-URI setting.
trans-unit.target: Select the data type in which you will specify this OMA-URI setting.

trans-unit.source: Specify the OMA-URI for which you want to supply a setting.
trans-unit.target: Specify the OMA-URI for which you want to supply a setting.

trans-unit.source: Specify the value to associate with the OMA-URI that you specified previously.
trans-unit.target: Specify the value to associate with the OMA-URI that you specified previously.

trans-unit.source: [Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies](manage-settings-and-features-on-your-devices-with-microsoft-intune-policies.md)
trans-unit.target: [Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies](manage-settings-and-features-on-your-devices-with-microsoft-intune-policies.md)
